intro: Cyphostemma oleraceum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a cylindrical, fleshy capsule that splits open to release seeds. Cyphostemma oleraceum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
